newsitem.title: USA: U.S. debt futures finish quiet, short day higher.
newsitem.headline: U.S. debt futures finish quiet, short day higher.

text.p: U.S. debt futures ended a shortened day higher in lackluster trade.
Treasury products at the Chicago Board of Trade closed early at 1210 CDT/1710 GMT and Chicago Mercantile Echange Eurodollar futures closed at 1200 CDT. Trade will be closed Monday for Memorial Day.
"It was just dead in here," a CBOT bond futures trader said. He said volume was extremely light as skeleton crews staffed trading desks and many traders began their long holidays early.
Most contracts posted very tight ranges Friday.
June T-bonds closed in the middle of their 109-1/32 to 109-12/32 Globex and day session range. A few traders said 109-12/32 -- Thursday's and Friday's high -- was minor resistance.
December Euros also ended squarely in the middle of their overall range of 93.705 to 93.745.
"Everybody is gone for the weekend," a Eurodollar pit source said. "The pit was basically empty."
He noted no significant futures plays during the last two hours of trade, saying the market was on hold before next week.
U.S. cash Treasury markets will wrap up trade by 1400 EDT/1800 GMT, and also will be closed on Monday.

Traders noted that the 109-00 to 108-30/32 area corresponds to the seven-percent cash yield and is an area to watch early next week. Support below there in June rests at 108-17/32, the 50-percent retracement of the 1-1/2-month upmove, according to Optima Technical Research.

At the close, June T-bonds were up 04/32 at 109-06/32, September T-bills were up 0.010 at 94.56, September Eurodollars were up 0.015 at 93.970, December Eurodollars were up 0.015 at 93.725 and June 10-year T-notes were up 03/32 at 107-04/32. ((DerivativesDesk(312)408-8750)) E-mail:derivatives@reuters.com
